properties.description: This initiative includes policies that address the ACN controls for Qualifications QC1.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-B2.T1-01
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Minimum Service Quality Indicators | [B2.T1-01] Availability: The percentage of time in a month that the cloud service is accessible and usable. The total time of the reference period, which serves as the basis for calculating the percentage, does not take catastrophic events into account. Catastrophic events are events that make the infrastructures used for the provision of the service unavailable for a prolonged period of time and upon the occurrence of which the Disaster Recovery solution is activated.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-B2.T1-02
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Minimum Service Quality Indicators | [B2.T1-02] Support hours - Support hours emergencies: The time at which the technical support service is operational for emergencies.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-B2.T1-03
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Minimum Service Quality Indicators | [B2.T1-03] Support activities - First Support Response Time: The maximum time that elapses between the reporting of an event with a critical impact on the operations of the Administration and the initial response to the report by the subject

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-B2.T1-04
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Minimum Service Quality Indicators | [B2.T1-04] Minor Release: The maximum notice period required to give notice, accompanied by known releases, to the Minor Release Administration. Minor Release means changes to the service that mainly concern corrections of software malfunctions (bugs) or in any case addition of new backwards compatible features.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-B2.T1-05
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Minimum Service Quality Indicators | [B2.T1-05] Major Release: The maximum notice period required to give notice, accompanied by known releases, to the Major Release Administration. Minor Release means changes to the service that affect a substantial evolution of the functionality of the service compared to the previous version.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-B2.T1-06
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Minimum Service Quality Indicators | [B2.T1-06] Minimum number of restore tests performed in a year

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [1] In order to promptly detect incidents with impact on the cloud service, technical and procedural tools are adopted | [a] Capture information from multiple sensors and sources | [b] receive and collect information concerning the security of the cloud service made known by CSIRT Italy, from sources internal or external to the subject | [c] analyze and correlate, also in an automated manner, the data and information referred to in letters a) and b), to promptly detect events of interest

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [2] The analysis and correlation activities referred to in the previous point are monitored and recorded. The relative documentation, including electronic documentation, is kept for at least 24 months.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [3] They are defined | [a] the policies applied to identify the sensors and sources referred to in point 1(a) | [b] the procedures and technical means for obtaining the information referred to in points (a) and (b) of point 1 | [c] the policies, processes and technical tools for analysis and correlation referred to in point 1(c) | [d] the processes and technical tools for monitoring and recording referred to in point 2

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [4] There are policies and procedures for logging, monitoring, security and retention of access logs, which must be updated at least on an annual basis.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_5
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [5] An auditing system shall be adopted for the detection of security information, access monitoring, unauthorized modification or deletion of data or metadata.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_6
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [6] Processes, procedures and technical measures for reporting anomalies and failures of the monitoring system are defined and evaluated and able to provide immediate notification to the responsible party.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_7
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [7] As part of the logging and monitoring activities, error management and logging tools are provided in relation to the cloud service that allow the Administration to define the desired retention period and to obtain information on the security status of the cloud service, as well as on the data and functions it provides. The information shall be sufficiently detailed to allow verification of the following aspects, insofar as it is applicable to the cloud service: | [a] What data, services or functions available to the user within the cloud service were consulted by whom and when (Audit Logs) | [b] Malfunctions when processing automatic or manual actions

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.AE-3_8
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Anomalies and Events (DE. AE): Anomalous activities are detected and their potential impact is analyzed | [DE.AE-3] Event information is collected and correlated by multiple sensors and sources | [8] For the service being qualified, it must be guaranteed that the logs can be integrated into the SIEM management and monitoring system of the Administration and that the log files are easily exportable by the Administration, preferably via API.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.CM-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Security Continuous Monitoring (DE. CM): Information systems and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and to verify the effectiveness of protection measures | [DE.CM-1] Computer network monitoring is carried out to detect potential cybersecurity events | [1] There are Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS)

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.CM-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Security Continuous Monitoring (DE. CM): Information systems and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and to verify the effectiveness of protection measures | [DE.CM-1] Computer network monitoring is carried out to detect potential cybersecurity events | [2] There are processes in place to monitor security events for applications and the underlying infrastructure

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.CM-1_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Security Continuous Monitoring (DE. CM): Information systems and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and to verify the effectiveness of protection measures | [DE.CM-1] Computer network monitoring is carried out to detect potential cybersecurity events | [3] An access monitoring system is provided in order to detect suspicious activity and establish a defined process for taking appropriate and timely actions in response to detected anomalies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.CM-4_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Security Continuous Monitoring (DE. CM): Information systems and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and to verify the effectiveness of protection measures | [DE.CM-4] Malicious code is detected | [1] Special tools are implemented and used for the prevention and detection of malware, as well as Endpoint Protection Systems (EPS)

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.CM-4_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Security Continuous Monitoring (DE. CM): Information systems and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and to verify the effectiveness of protection measures | [DE.CM-4] Malicious code is detected | [2] There are anti-malware protection policies, which will need to be reviewed at least annually

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.DP-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Detection Processes (DE. DP): Monitoring processes and procedures are adopted, maintained and verified to ensure the understanding of anomalous events | [DE.DP-1] Roles and responsibilities for monitoring processes are well defined in order to ensure accountability | [1] The nominations in subcategory ID.AM-6 are announced within the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.DP-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Detection Processes (DE. DP): Monitoring processes and procedures are adopted, maintained and verified to ensure the understanding of anomalous events | [DE.DP-1] Roles and responsibilities for monitoring processes are well defined in order to ensure accountability | [2] The roles, processes and responsibilities for the activities leading to the detection of incidents impacting the cloud service are well defined and made known to the competent articulations of the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.DP-1_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Detection Processes (DE. DP): Monitoring processes and procedures are adopted, maintained and verified to ensure the understanding of anomalous events | [DE.DP-1] Roles and responsibilities for monitoring processes are well defined in order to ensure accountability | [3] There is an updated detail document that states at least: | [a] the roles, processes and responsibilities referred to in point 2 | [b] the processes for the dissemination of appointments, roles and processes referred to in points 1 and 2

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-DE.DP-1_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Detection Processes (DE. DP): Monitoring processes and procedures are adopted, maintained and verified to ensure the understanding of anomalous events | [DE.DP-1] Roles and responsibilities for monitoring processes are well defined in order to ensure accountability | [4] A system is defined and implemented for notifying the Administration of anomalous events involving the applications and the underlying infrastructure, identified on the basis of previously agreed PaaS, SaaS metrics.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-1] The systems and physical equipment in use in the organization are surveyed | [1] All physical systems and apparatuses are surveyed and there is a list of those approved by actors within the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-1] The systems and physical equipment in use in the organization are surveyed | [2] All systems and physical equipment present on the networks are registered and access to the network is allowed only to those approved.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-2_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-2] The platforms and software applications in use in the organization are surveyed | [1] All installed platforms and software applications are surveyed and there is a list of those approved by actors within the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-2_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-2] The platforms and software applications in use in the organization are surveyed | [2] Installation of software platforms and applications is only permitted for approved platforms.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-2_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-2] The platforms and software applications in use in the organization are surveyed | [3] There are policies that limit the addition, removal, or upgrade, as well as unauthorized management of your organization's assets.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-3_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-3] Data flows and communications related to the organization are identified | [1] All information flows, including those to the outside and related to the cloud service, are identified and approved by actors within the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-6_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-6] Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are defined and disclosed for all personnel and for any relevant third parties (e.g. suppliers, customers, partners) | [1] The cybersecurity organization is defined and made known to the competent articulations of the subject, also with reference to roles and responsibilities, for all personnel and for any third parties.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-6_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-6] Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are defined and disclosed for all personnel and for any relevant third parties (e.g. suppliers, customers, partners) | [2] Within the structure referred to in point 1, a person in charge is appointed, and a possible substitute, with the task of managing the implementation of the provisions of the Regulation in possession of specific professionalism and skills in the field of cyber security, who reports directly to the top of the hierarchy of the subject and ensures the effective implementation of the security measures referred to in this Annex.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-6_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-6] Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are defined and disclosed for all personnel and for any relevant third parties (e.g. suppliers, customers, partners) | [3] A technical contact person and at least one substitute are appointed, within the structure referred to in point 1, in possession of technical-specialized skills in the field of cyber security, to carry out the functions of dialogue with the CSIRT Italy for the purpose of managing incidents having an impact on the cloud service.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.AM-6_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Asset Management (ID.AM): The data, personnel, devices and systems and facilities needed by the organization are identified and managed in line with the organization's objectives and risk strategy | [ID.AM-6] Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are defined and disclosed for all personnel and for any relevant third parties (e.g. suppliers, customers, partners) | [4] The person in charge referred to in point 2 and the technical contact person referred to in point 3 shall work closely together.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.GV-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Governance (ID.GV): The policies, procedures and processes to manage and monitor the organization's requirements (organizational, legal, risk-related, environmental) are included and used in cybersecurity risk management | [ID.GV-1] A cybersecurity policy is identified and disclosed | [1] There is an updated document that describes cybersecurity policies, processes and procedures.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.GV-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Governance (ID.GV): The policies, procedures and processes to manage and monitor the organization's requirements (organizational, legal, risk-related, environmental) are included and used in cybersecurity risk management | [ID.GV-1] A cybersecurity policy is identified and disclosed | [2] The Document referred to in point 1 must be approved by the subject and updated at least on an annual basis or in correspondence with substantial changes within the organization.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.GV-4_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Governance (ID.GV): The policies, procedures and processes to manage and monitor the organization's requirements (organizational, legal, risk-related, environmental) are included and used in cybersecurity risk management | [ID.GV-4] Governance and risk management processes include the management of cybersecurity risks | [1] The updated document describing risk management processes includes the cybersecurity risk part of it.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.GV-4_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Governance (ID.GV): The policies, procedures and processes to manage and monitor the organization's requirements (organizational, legal, risk-related, environmental) are included and used in cybersecurity risk management | [ID.GV-4] Governance and risk management processes include the management of cybersecurity risks | [2] There is a formal Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program that includes policies and procedures for identifying, assessing, owning, treating, and accepting cloud security and privacy risks.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.RA-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Risk Assessment (ID.RA): The enterprise understands the cybersecurity risk inherent in the organization's operations (including mission, functions, image or reputation), assets and individuals. | [ID.RA-1] Vulnerabilities in your organization's resources (e.g., systems, premises, devices) are identified and documented | [1] There is an updated security verification and testing plan that describes all the activities aimed at assessing the cyber security level of the Digital Infrastructure and the effectiveness of technical and procedural security measures, which also contains the periodicity and methods of execution.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.RA-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Risk Assessment (ID.RA): The enterprise understands the cybersecurity risk inherent in the organization's operations (including mission, functions, image or reputation), assets and individuals. | [ID.RA-1] Vulnerabilities in your organization's resources (e.g., systems, premises, devices) are identified and documented | [2] There are procedures, to be updated at least annually, for managing risks associated with changes in organizational assets, including applications, systems, infrastructure, configurations, etc., regardless of whether the assets are managed internally or externally (i.e. outsourced).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.RA-5_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Risk Assessment (ID.RA): The enterprise understands the cybersecurity risk inherent in the organization's operations (including mission, functions, image or reputation), assets and individuals. | [ID.RA-5] Threats, vulnerabilities, their probabilities of occurrence and consequent impacts are used to determine the risk | [1] The risk analysis is carried out according to threats, vulnerabilities, the relative probability of occurrence and the consequent impacts deriving from their exploitation in light of the threats considered.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.RA-5_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Risk Assessment (ID.RA): The enterprise understands the cybersecurity risk inherent in the organization's operations (including mission, functions, image or reputation), assets and individuals. | [ID.RA-5] Threats, vulnerabilities, their probabilities of occurrence and consequent impacts are used to determine the risk | [2] The risk analysis takes into account the internal and external dependencies of the Digital Infrastructure.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.RA-5_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Risk Assessment (ID.RA): The enterprise understands the cybersecurity risk inherent in the organization's operations (including mission, functions, image or reputation), assets and individuals. | [ID.RA-5] Threats, vulnerabilities, their probabilities of occurrence and consequent impacts are used to determine the risk | [3] After identifying all risk factors and analysing them, a weighting is carried out to determine the level of risk.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.SC-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Supply Chain Risk Management (ID.SC): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with supply chain risk management. The organization has defined and implemented processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risk | [ID.SC-1] The risk management processes inherent in the cyber supply chain are identified, well defined, validated, managed and approved by actors within the organization | [1] There is an updated detailed document describing cyber supply chain risk management processes

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-ID.SC-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Supply Chain Risk Management (ID.SC): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with supply chain risk management. The organization has defined and implemented processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risk | [ID.SC-1] The risk management processes inherent in the cyber supply chain are identified, well defined, validated, managed and approved by actors within the organization | [2] These processes are validated and approved by the top management of the subject

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-IP.PO-2_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Interoperability and portability: Portability | [IP.PO-2] Data interoperability and portability are managed through regularly updated procedures and policies. Data portability involves the application of secure network protocols and access to data at the end of contractual relationships is managed through specific agreements. | [1] Policies and procedures for interoperability and portability shall be defined and reviewed and updated at least annually, including requirements for: | [a] Communications between application interfaces | [b] Interoperability of information processing | [c] Application Development Portability | [d] Exchange, use, portability, integrity and persistence of PaaS, SaaS information/data

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-IP.PO-2_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Interoperability and portability: Portability | [IP.PO-2] Data interoperability and portability are managed through regularly updated procedures and policies. Data portability involves the application of secure network protocols and access to data at the end of contractual relationships is managed through specific agreements. | [2] Encrypted and standardized network protocols are implemented for the management, import and export of PaaS, SaaS data

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-IP.PO-2_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Interoperability and portability: Portability | [IP.PO-2] Data interoperability and portability are managed through regularly updated procedures and policies. Data portability involves the application of secure network protocols and access to data at the end of contractual relationships is managed through specific agreements. | [3] Provisions specifying the Administration's access to data at the end of the contract are included in the agreements, including: | [a] Data format | [b] Duration of time in which the data will be stored | [c] Scope of data stored and made available to the Administration | [d] PaaS, SaaS Data Erasure Policy

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-1] Digital identities and login credentials for authorized users, devices, and processes are administered, verified, revoked, and audited for security | [1] Access credentials are individual for the subject's staff and respect the principle of segregation of functions. The credentials are updated with a frequency proportionate to the privileges of the user.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-1] Digital identities and login credentials for authorized users, devices, and processes are administered, verified, revoked, and audited for security | [2] There are policies and procedures for the management of credentials referred to in point 1, which must be updated at least on an annual basis and made available, for consultation, to the Administration.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-1_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-1] Digital identities and login credentials for authorized users, devices, and processes are administered, verified, revoked, and audited for security | [3] Mechanisms for managing, storing, and reviewing information regarding credentials, system identity, and access level are defined.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-1_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-1] Digital identities and login credentials for authorized users, devices, and processes are administered, verified, revoked, and audited for security | [4] The credentials are updated promptly and without undue delay if there are changes in users (e.g. transfer of personnel).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-1_5
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-1] Digital identities and login credentials for authorized users, devices, and processes are administered, verified, revoked, and audited for security | [5] System identities are managed using digital certificates or alternative techniques that provide an equivalent level of security.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-1_6
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-1] Digital identities and login credentials for authorized users, devices, and processes are administered, verified, revoked, and audited for security | [6] There is an up-to-date schedule of planned digital identity security audits and a record of audits carried out with related documentation.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-3_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-3] Remote access to resources is administered | [1] Remote logins made are monitored by the cybersecurity organization.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-3_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-3] Remote access to resources is administered | [2] Without prejudice to documented technical limitations, adequate access control measures are implemented, adopting centralized authentication, authorization and registration/accounting systems of access, assisted by authentication systems, whose security is proportional to the risk.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-3_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-3] Remote access to resources is administered | [3] A centralized access management model is defined and implemented aimed at the authorization, logging and communication processes of access to resources and data of the Administration.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-3_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-3] Remote access to resources is administered | [4] There is a log of remote access.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-4_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-4] Access rights to resources and their permissions shall be administered on a basis of least privilege and segregation of duties. | [1] The following shall be defined, with reference to the censuses referred to in category ID.AM, at least: | [a] the resources surveyed to which it is necessary to access, for which functions and with what permissions. | [b] user groups and their privileges in relation to the resources they can access and with what permissions. | [c] the assignment of registered users to groups of users.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-4_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-4] Access rights to resources and their permissions shall be administered on a basis of least privilege and segregation of duties. | [2] As part of the implementation of access to the information system, principles of separation of functions and least privilege in relation to organizational risk are observed.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-4_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-4] Access rights to resources and their permissions shall be administered on a basis of least privilege and segregation of duties. | [3] Policies and procedures, technical measures for the segregation of privileged access roles are defined and implemented so that administrative access to data, encryption and key management capabilities, and logging capabilities are distinct and separate.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-5_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-5] Network integrity is protected (e.g. network segregation, network segmentation) | [1] There are policies and procedures for the security of the network infrastructure, which must be updated at least on an annual basis.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-5_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-5] Network integrity is protected (e.g. network segregation, network segmentation) | [2] A plan is defined for monitoring the availability, quality and adequate capacity of resources in order to provide the required system performance.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-7_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-7] Authentication methods (e.g., single or multiple factor authentication) for subject users, devices, and other assets are commensurate with transaction risk (e.g., risks related to the security and privacy of individuals and other risks to the organization) | [1] Policies and procedures for system, application, and data access are defined and implemented, including multi-factor authentication for at least privileged users and access to data.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AC-7_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR. AC): Access to physical and logical assets and related resources is limited to authorized personnel, processes and devices, and is managed in a manner consistent with the assessment of the risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions | [PR.AC-7] Authentication methods (e.g., single or multiple factor authentication) for subject users, devices, and other assets are commensurate with transaction risk (e.g., risks related to the security and privacy of individuals and other risks to the organization) | [2] In relation to the cloud service, the Administration must be granted the functionality of multi-factor authentication or the use of third-party multi-factor authentication solutions. Transparent information about the multi-factor authentication capabilities accessible to the National Cybersecurity Agency (ACN) and the Administration must be made available, with specifications on the mechanisms used for authentication (e.g. email, sms or biometric check).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AT-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Awareness and Training (PR. AT): Staff and third parties are sensitized to cybersecurity and are trained to fulfill their duties and roles consistent with existing policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.AT-1] The subject's staff is informed and trained | [1] There is an updated detailed document that indicates the contents of the training and training provided to the subject's personnel and how to verify the acquisition of content.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AT-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
Awareness and Training (PR. AT): Staff and third parties are sensitized to cybersecurity and are trained to fulfill their duties and roles consistent with existing policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.AT-1] The subject's staff is informed and trained | [2] The training and training referred to in point 1 provided to users of the subject, in relation to roles, shall include, at least, the following topics:

a. the protection of the confidentiality of clear or encrypted data.
b. the restitution of assets of a business nature at the end of the employment relationship
d. the definition of roles and responsibilities
E. Policies for access to systems, assets and resources
F. Information and security management policies
g. processes of communication of roles and responsibilities to employees who have access to information assets
H. Requirements for non-disclosure/confidentiality of information

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AT-2_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Awareness and Training (PR. AT): Staff and third parties are sensitized to cybersecurity and are trained to fulfill their duties and roles consistent with existing policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.AT-2] Privileged users (e.g. System Administrators) understand their roles and responsibilities | [1] The contents of the instruction provided to the staff of the privileged subject and the methods of verifying the acquisition of content are defined.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.AT-2_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Awareness and Training (PR. AT): Staff and third parties are sensitized to cybersecurity and are trained to fulfill their duties and roles consistent with existing policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.AT-2] Privileged users (e.g. System Administrators) understand their roles and responsibilities | [2] The privileges and instructions received shall be defined for each member of the subject's staff.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-1] Stored data is protected | [1] They are defined, also in relation to category ID.AM, at least | [a] the security policies adopted for the storage and protection of data | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-1] Stored data is protected | [2] With reference to the infrastructures used for the provision of the cloud service to the processing of data and services of the Administration, without prejudice to the provisions of Annex B to the Regulation, SC-SI-PR requirement. DS-1-01, if there are justified and documented technical limitations, any metadata necessary for the provision of the cloud service may be processed through the use of physical and technological infrastructures located outside the territory of the European Union. In this case, the aforementioned metadata may not contain, even in part, the data of the Administration.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-1_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-1] Stored data is protected | [3] With reference to access to data by non-EU entities, the subject | [a] reports to the National Cybersecurity Agency (ACN) and the Administration any request for access to data or metadata by non-EU entities | [b] provides access to Administration data or metadata to non-EU entities only after an explicit authorization by the Administration

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-1_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-1] Stored data is protected | [4] The subject guarantees autonomy to the Administration in the management of its cryptographic keys and, in particular, | [a] There is an updated document of detail concerning the procedures of encryption, encryption and key management, which must be updated at least on an annual basis, and containing a precise indication of roles and responsibilities | [b] There is a periodic audit of encryption and key management systems, policies and processes in response to increased risk exposure, assessed through audits to be performed at least annually or after any security event. | [c] cryptographic keys are generated using cryptographic libraries with an indication of the algorithm and random number generator used | [d] Secret and private cryptographic keys are generated for a single purpose | [e] Cryptographic key rotation mechanisms are provided according to the validity period of the same, taking into account possible risks and regulatory and legal requirements

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-1_5
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-1] Stored data is protected | [5] There are processes, procedures, and technical measures in place to revoke and remove cryptographic keys before the end of their validity period, when a key is compromised, or an entity is no longer part of the organization, in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-1_6
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-1] Stored data is protected | [6] Processes, procedures and measures are defined and implemented for the creation, deactivation of keys upon expiration, any suspensions and management mechanisms for access keys to repositories

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-2_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-2] Data is protected during transmission | [1] Secure and encrypted communication channels are used when migrating servers, services, applications or data to cloud environments. These channels should include only up-to-date and approved protocols.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-3_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-3] The physical transfer, removal and destruction of data storage devices is handled through a formal process. | [1] They are defined in relation to the category ID.AM | [a] the security policies adopted for the physical transfer, removal and destruction of devices suitable for storing data | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-5_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-5] Protection techniques (e.g. access control) against data theft are implemented | [1] They shall be defined in relation to category ID.AM, at least | [a] the security policies adopted for access to data | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-5_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-5] Protection techniques (e.g. access control) against data theft are implemented | [2] Data Loss Prevention policies are adopted in line with risk assessment

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-6_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-6] Data integrity check mechanisms are used to verify the authenticity of software, firmware and information | [1] They shall be defined in relation to category ID.AM, at least | [a] the list of data integrity checking mechanisms to verify the authenticity of software, firmware and information | [b] the security policies adopted to assign a mechanism to a resource and which of these mechanisms is applied to which resource | [c] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.DS-7_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is stored and managed in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy, in order to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information | [PR.DS-7] Development and test environments are separate from production environments | [1] They are defined in relation to the category ID.AM | [a] the general architecture for which the environments are separated and, at any points of contact, how the separation is realized | [b] the security policies adopted to ensure the separation of the development and test environment from the production one | [c] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-1] Reference practices (so-called baseline) are defined and managed for the configuration of IT and industrial control systems that incorporate security principles (e.g. principle of minimum functionality) | [1] Policies and procedures are defined with reference to application security to provide adequate support for the planning, implementation and maintenance of application security features, which must be reviewed and updated at least on an annual basis. [IaaS,SaaS]

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-12_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-12] A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented | [1] There is an updated detail document that states at least | [a] the security policies adopted to manage vulnerabilities | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-12_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-12] A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented | [2] Procedures and technical measures are defined and implemented to update detection tools, threat signatures and indicators of compromise, which must be reviewed and updated frequently or on a weekly basis.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-3_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-3] Configuration change control processes are active | [1] They are defined | [a] the security policies adopted to update the configurations of IT and industrial control systems and to control the modification of the configurations in use compared to those provided | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-3_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-3] Configuration change control processes are active | [2] A procedure for handling exceptions, including emergencies, is implemented in the change and configuration process

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-3_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-3] Configuration change control processes are active | [3] Recovery plans are defined and implemented in the previous state (so-called rollback) in case of errors or security problems

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-4_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-4] Information backups are performed, administered and verified | [1] They are defined, also in relation to category ID.AM, at least | [a] the security policies adopted to back up information | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-4_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-4] Information backups are performed, administered and verified | [2] A backup of data stored in the cloud is made periodically. The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup data is ensured

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-4_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-4] Information backups are performed, administered and verified | [3] The backup copies of information, software and system images of the cloud service are protected with strong encryption and regularly stored in remote sites (in compliance with the provisions of the PR.DS category). If backups are transmitted to a remote site over a network, the transmission must be protected with strong encryption

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-4_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-4] Information backups are performed, administered and verified | [4] The restore (restore test) of the backup copies is periodically verified as per the objective (SLO) identified for the corresponding service indicator (SLI) reported in Table 1 "Minimum indicators of the quality of the Service"

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-9_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-9] Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) in the event of an accident/disaster are active and administered | [1] The impact of business interruptions and possible risks is determined in order to establish the criteria for developing business continuity strategies and capabilities.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-9_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-9] Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) in the event of an accident/disaster are active and administered | [2] There is an up-to-date detailed document containing business continuity plans, as well as incident response plans, which includes at least | [a] the policies and processes used to identify event priorities | [b] the implementation phases of the plans | [c] the roles and responsibilities of staff | [d] communication and reporting flows | [e] the connection with CSIRT Italy

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-9_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-9] Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) in the event of an accident/disaster are active and administered | [3] There is an updated document listing education, training and exercise activities carried out.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-9_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-9] Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) in the event of an accident/disaster are active and administered | [4] Business continuity plans are tested and communicated to interested parties.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.IP-9_5
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information Protection Processes and Procedures (PR. IP): Security policies (which address purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, commitment by management and coordination between the various organizational entities), processes and procedures to manage the protection of information systems and assets are implemented and adapted over time | [PR.IP-9] Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) in the event of an accident/disaster are active and administered | [5] The documentation referred to in point 2 is made available, where requested, to the Administration and reviewed periodically.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.MA-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Maintenance (PR. MA): Maintenance of industrial information and control systems is done in accordance with existing policies and procedures | [PR.MA-1] The maintenance and repair of assets and systems is performed and recorded with controlled and authorized instruments | [1] They are also defined in relation to category ID.AM, at least | [a] the security policies adopted for the registration of maintenance and repair of assets and systems | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.MA-2_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Maintenance (PR. MA): Maintenance of industrial information and control systems is done in accordance with existing policies and procedures | [PR.MA-2] Remote maintenance of assets and systems is approved, documented and carried out in a way that prevents unauthorized access | [1] The maintenance of assets and systems (including activities related to security functions) carried out remotely is carried out in compliance with the measures set out in subcategory PR. AC-3 and the following points.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.MA-2_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Maintenance (PR. MA): Maintenance of industrial information and control systems is done in accordance with existing policies and procedures | [PR.MA-2] Remote maintenance of assets and systems is approved, documented and carried out in a way that prevents unauthorized access | [2] All remote access by third-party personnel is authorized by the cybersecurity organization and limited to essential cases only.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.MA-2_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Maintenance (PR. MA): Maintenance of industrial information and control systems is done in accordance with existing policies and procedures | [PR.MA-2] Remote maintenance of assets and systems is approved, documented and carried out in a way that prevents unauthorized access | [3] Stringent protection mechanisms are adopted for authentication, identification and event tracking.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.MA-2_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Maintenance (PR. MA): Maintenance of industrial information and control systems is done in accordance with existing policies and procedures | [PR.MA-2] Remote maintenance of assets and systems is approved, documented and carried out in a way that prevents unauthorized access | [4] Management and control mechanisms for privileged users are adopted, in terms of time limitations and available administrative functions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.MA-2_5
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Maintenance (PR. MA): Maintenance of industrial information and control systems is done in accordance with existing policies and procedures | [PR.MA-2] Remote maintenance of assets and systems is approved, documented and carried out in a way that prevents unauthorized access | [5] All logs relating to remote communication sessions and activities performed on remote systems are produced and stored on systems separate from those subject to intervention and not accessible by remote users.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.PT-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Protective Technology (PR.PT): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.PT-1] A policy exists and is implemented to define, implement and review system logs | [1] Logs are kept securely, possibly centrally, for at least 24 months.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.PT-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Protective Technology (PR.PT): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.PT-1] A policy exists and is implemented to define, implement and review system logs | [2] They are defined | [a] the security policies adopted for the management of system logs | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with security policies with particular regard to the integrity and availability of logs

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.PT-5_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Protective Technology (PR.PT): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.PT-5] Mechanisms are implemented (e.g. failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) that allow to meet resilience requirements both during normal operation and in adverse situations | [1] In relation to the plans provided by the PR subcategory. IP-9 | [a] redundant network architectures, connectivity and application architectures are adopted

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.PT-5_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Protective Technology (PR.PT): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.PT-5] Mechanisms are implemented (e.g. failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) that allow to meet resilience requirements both during normal operation and in adverse situations | [2] There are mechanisms to ensure continuity of service, in compliance with the security measures listed here.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PR.PT-5_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Protective Technology (PR.PT): Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures and agreements | [PR.PT-5] Mechanisms are implemented (e.g. failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) that allow to meet resilience requirements both during normal operation and in adverse situations | [3] They are defined | [a] the security policies adopted in relation to points 1 and 2 | [b] the processes, methodologies and technologies used that contribute to compliance with safety policies

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-PS.SC-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Performance and scalability: Service scalability | [PS.SC-1] Transparency on how and how to scale | [1] The subject communicates to the Administration: | [a] the scalability mechanism offered (e.g. automatic and configurable, native, manual) | [b] the type (horizontal and/or vertical) | [c] the maximum load conditions that can be supported by the service (e.g. number of concurrent users and/or volume of requests that can be processed) | [d] configuration methods (e.g. based on monitoring metrics, planned over time) | [e] the minimum reaction time of the service to the request for new resources (e.g. activation of new resources)

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-QU.SE-2_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Quality of service | [QU.SE-2] Adequate service and support is provided | [1] The support and assistance service to the Administration for the cloud service is guaranteed.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-QU.SE-2_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Quality of service | [QU.SE-2] Adequate service and support is provided | [2] The support and assistance service referred to in point 1 is provided at least in Italian every day of the year at any time (24/7/365).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-QU.SE-2_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Quality of service | [QU.SE-2] Adequate service and support is provided | [3] The support and assistance service referred to in point 1 shall be accessible at least by telephone number and e-mail.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-QU.SE-2_4
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Quality of service | [QU.SE-2] Adequate service and support is provided | [4] The support and assistance service referred to in point 1 also provides a troubleshooting system available to the Administration, also guaranteeing exposure through APIs to allow programmatic interaction with problem management systems (Case Management System).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-QU.SE-4_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Quality of service | [QU.SE-4] Guidelines and recommendations on the secure use of cloud solutions | [1] The guidelines for the secure management of the qualified cloud service must be made available to the Administration, addressing, where applicable, the following aspects: | [a] Instructions for secure setup | [b] Information about known vulnerabilities and update mechanisms | [c] Error handling and logging mechanisms | [d] Authentication mechanisms | [e] Roles and rights, including combinations that result in high risk | [f] Services and functions for privileged user service administration | [g] The guidelines are provided and maintained in the manner and timing referred to in the IP measure. GR-01

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RC.RP-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Recovery Planning (RC. RP): Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure recovery of systems or assets affected by a cybersecurity incident | [RC.RP-1] There is a recovery plan and it is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident | [1] There is a recovery plan that includes, at least, the processes and procedures necessary to restore the normal functioning of cloud services affected by a cybersecurity incident.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.AN-5_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Analysis (RS. AN): Analyses are conducted to ensure effective response and support for recovery activities | [RS.AN-5] Processes are defined to receive, analyze, and respond to information about vulnerabilities disclosed from sources inside or outside the organization (e.g., internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers). | [1] The results of the evaluations referred to in subcategory DE. AE-3 and penetration tests and vulnerability assessments referred to in subcategory DE. CM-8, where available, are disseminated to the competent joints of the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.AN-5_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Analysis (RS. AN): Analyses are conducted to ensure effective response and support for recovery activities | [RS.AN-5] Processes are defined to receive, analyze, and respond to information about vulnerabilities disclosed from sources inside or outside the organization (e.g., internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers). | [2] The communication channels of the CSIRT Italy referred to in Article 4 of the Decree of the President of the Council of Ministers of 8 August 2019, of the reference Authority of its production sector, as well as of any reference CERT and Information Sharing & Analysis Centre (ISAC) are monitored.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.AN-5_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Analysis (RS. AN): Analyses are conducted to ensure effective response and support for recovery activities | [RS.AN-5] Processes are defined to receive, analyze, and respond to information about vulnerabilities disclosed from sources inside or outside the organization (e.g., internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers). | [3] There is an updated document that describes, at least: | [a] the modalities to receive, analyse and respond at least to the information collected through the activities referred to in points 1 and 2 | [b] the processes, roles, responsibilities and technical means for carrying out the activities referred to in points 1 and 2

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.CO-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Communications (RS.CO): Response activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. possible support from law enforcement agencies or law enforcement agencies) | [RS.CO-1] Staff know their role and what they need to do if an incident response is needed | [1] The roles and responsibilities for carrying out the phases and processes referred to in point 1 are well defined and made known to the competent articulations of the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.CO-1_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Communications (RS.CO): Response activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. possible support from law enforcement agencies or law enforcement agencies) | [RS.CO-1] Staff know their role and what they need to do if an incident response is needed | [2] Exercises are carried out periodically.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.CO-1_3
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Communications (RS.CO): Response activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. possible support from law enforcement agencies or law enforcement agencies) | [RS.CO-1] Staff know their role and what they need to do if an incident response is needed | [3] There is an updated detail document that states at least: | [a] the phases, processes, roles and responsibilities referred to in points 1 and 2 | [b] the processes for the dissemination of the phases, processes, roles and responsibilities referred to in points 1 and 2 | [c] the modalities for the exercises referred to in point 3

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.CO-5_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Communications (RS.CO): Response activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. possible support from law enforcement agencies or law enforcement agencies) | [RS.CO-5] A spontaneous sharing of information with stakeholders outside the organization is implemented (information sharing) to obtain greater situational awareness | [1] Contacts are established and maintained with cloud-related interest groups and other relevant entities and in line with the context of the subject.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.CO-5_2
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Communications (RS.CO): Response activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. possible support from law enforcement agencies or law enforcement agencies) | [RS.CO-5] A spontaneous sharing of information with stakeholders outside the organization is implemented (information sharing) to obtain greater situational awareness | [2] Contact points with applicable regulatory authorities, national and local law enforcement agencies and other legal courts shall be established and maintained.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-RS.RP-1_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Response Planning (RS. RP): Response procedures and processes are executed and maintained to ensure a response to detected cybersecurity incidents | [RS.RP-1] There is a response plan and this is executed during or after an incident | [1] The response plan provides for the timely execution of the evaluation of the events detected through the analysis and correlation referred to in category DE as well as the immediate dissemination of the results to the competent articulations of the subject, also for the purpose of notifying the Administration and, on a voluntary basis, to the CSIRT Italy, of incidents with impact on the cloud service.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: ACN-B2-1-QU.LS-4_1
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Service Level (SLA) | [QU.LS-4] A monitoring service (alarms and parameters) is available and any native integrations with market-leading solutions are announced. | [1] The subject makes available to the Administration access to one or more monitoring tools for the cloud service. They must allow collection, monitoring, filtering, reporting through predefined or parameterizable parameters and allow the Administration to set custom alarms. The maximum granularity of operations should not exceed one minute (e.g., it should be possible to filter or collect events every minute). In addition, the subject specifies the possible availability of third-party APIs and monitoring tools natively integrated with the qualified service.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes cluster services should listen only on allowed ports : [Allowed service ports list]
metadata.description: The list of service ports allowed in a Kubernetes cluster. Array only accepts strings. Example: ["443", "80"]

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed images : [Allowed registry or registries regex]
metadata.description: The RegEx rule used to match allowed container image field in a Kubernetes cluster. For example, to allow any Azure Container Registry image by matching partial path: ^[^\/]+\.azurecr\.io\/.+$ and for multiple registries: ^([^\/]+\.azurecr\.io|registry\.io)\/.+$

metadata.displayName: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations : [Operation Name]
metadata.description: Administrative Operation name for which activity log alert should be configured

metadata.displayName: Only approved VM extensions should be installed : [Approved extensions]
metadata.description: The list of approved extension types that can be installed. Example: AzureDiskEncryption

metadata.displayName: An activity log alert should exist for specific Policy operations : [Operation Name]
metadata.description: Policy Operation name for which activity log alert should exist

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes cluster containers CPU and memory resource limits should not exceed the specified limits : [Max allowed CPU units]
metadata.description: The maximum CPU units allowed for a container. E.g. 200m. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes cluster containers CPU and memory resource limits should not exceed the specified limits : [Max allowed memory bytes]
metadata.description: The maximum memory bytes allowed for a container. E.g. 1Gi. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: An activity log alert should exist for specific Security operations : [Operation Name]
metadata.description: Security Operation name for which activity log alert should exist
